Have you ever heard of #cholera? It's an infection of the small intestine that can cause profuse watery diarrhea, leg cramps and vomiting.
#cholera is typically found in water or food contaminated with feces. Very rarely is it contracted by eating raw shellfish.
In an epidemic, #cholera can spread rapidly in areas with inadequate treatment of sewage and drinking water.
5% of persons infected with #cholera will have severe enough symptoms that lead to dehydration and shock. Untreated, death can occur.
Antibiotics can shorten the duration and lessen the severity of #cholera, but are not as essential as rehydration.
